gurmukhi: ieiq cqurQ Avqwr bHmw bcys smwpqM ]
transliteration: It(i) Chaturath Avtaar Brahmaa Baches Samaapatan||
translation: End of the description of Baches, the fourth incarnation of Brahma.

gurmukhi: AQ pMcmo Avqwr bHmw ibAws mnu rwjw ko rwj kHHQnM ]
transliteration: Ath Panchamo Avtaar Brahmaa Biaas Manu Raajaa Ko Raaj Kathanan||
translation: Now being the description of Vyas, the fifth incarnation of Brahma and the description of the rule of king menu.

gurmukhi: qRyqw ibqIq jug duAwpurwn ] bhu BwNiq dyK Kyly iKlwn ] jb BXo Awn kiRSnwvqwr ] qb Bey bXws muK Awn cwr ]5]
transliteration: Tretaa Biteet Joug Duaapuraan|| Bahu Bhaant(i) Dekh Khele Khilaan|| Jab Bhayo Aan Krishnaavataar|| Tab Bhae Byaas Moukh Aan Chaar||5||
translation: Treat age passed and Dwapar age came, when Krishna manifested himself and performed various kinds of sports, then Vyas was born; he had a charming face.5.

gurmukhi: jy jy cirqR kIey kiRSn dyv ] qy qy Bny su swrdw qyv ] Ab kho qaun sMCyp Twn ] ijh BwNq kIn sRI AiBrwm ]6]
transliteration: Je Je Charitra Keee Krishan Dev|| Te Te Bhane Su Saardaa Tev|| Ab Kaho Taoun Sanchhep Thaan|| Jih Bhaant Keen Sri Abhiraam||6||
translation: Whatever sports Krishna performed, he described them with the halp of Saraswati the godess of learning; now I describe them in brief, all the works, which Vyas executed.6.

gurmukhi: ijh BwNiq k`iQ kIno pswr ] iqh BwNiq kwib kiQ hY ibcwr ] kho jYs kwbX kihXo ibXws ] qaunY kQwn k`Qo pRBws ]7]
transliteration: Jih Bhaant(i) Katth(i) Keeno Pasaar|| Tih Bhaant(i) Kaab(i) Kath(i) Hai Bichaar|| Kaho Jais Kaabyo Kahiyo Biyaas|| Taounai Kathaan Kathho Prabhaas||7||
translation: The manner in which he propagated his writings, in the same manner, I relate the same here thoughtfully; the poetry that Vyas composed, I now relate here same type of glorious sayings.7.

gurmukhi: jy Bey BUp BUA mo mhwn ] iqnko sujwn k`Qq khwn ] kh lgy qwis ik`jY ibcwr ] suix lyhu bYn sMCyp Xwr ]8]
transliteration: Je Bhae Bhoop Bhooa Mo Mahaan|| Tinko Sujaan Katthat Kahaan Kab Lage Taas(i) Kijjai Bichaar|| Soun(i) Leh(u) Bain Sanchhep Yaar||8||
translation: The scholars describe the stories of all the great kings, who ruled over the earth; to what extent, they may be narrated, O my fried! Listen to the same in brief.8.

gurmukhi: jy Bey BUp qy khy bXws ] hovq purwx qy nwm Bws ] mnu BXo rwj mih ko BUAwr ] KVgn spMn mihmw Apwr ]9]
transliteration: Je Bhae Bhoop Te Kahe Byaas|| Hovat Puraan Te Naam Bhaas|| Manu Bhayo Raaj Maih Ko Bhooaar|| Khadgann Sapann Mahimaa Apaar||9||
translation: Vayas narrated the exploits of the erstwhile kings, we gather this from the Puranas;there had been one mighty and glorious king named manu.9.

gurmukhi: mwnvI siRSt ik`nI pRkwS ] ds lok AwBw ABws ] mihmw Apwr brny su kaun ] suix s√çx ikq huie rhY maun ]10]
transliteration: Maanavisrisht Kinniprakaadh|| Das Chaar Lok Aabhaa Abhaas|| Mahimaa Apaar Barne Su Kaoun|| Soun(i) Sravan Kit Hue Rahai Maoun||10||
translation: He brought to the human words and extending his approbation his greatness? and listening to his praise one can only remain mute.10.

gurmukhi: ds cwr cwr ib`idAw inDwn ] Air jIq jIq id`no inSwn ] mMfy mhIp mwvws Kyq ] g`jy mswx n`cy pryq ]11]
transliteration: Das Chaar Chaar Biddiaa Nidhaan|| Ar(i) Jeet Jeet Dinno Nishaan|| Mande Naheep Maanaas Khet|| Gadje Masaan Nachche Daret||11||
translation: He was ocean of eighteen sciences and he got his trumpets sounded after conquering his enemies; he made many person kings, and those who resisted, he killed them; the ghosts and fiends also used to dance in his battlefield.11.

gurmukhi: ijqy sudys eysur mvws ] ik`ny Krwb Kwny Kvws ] BMfy ABMf mMfy mhIp ] id`ny inkwr iC`ny su dIp ]12]
transliteration: Jite Sudes Esur Mavaas|| Kinne Kharaab Khaane Khavaas|| Bhande Abhand Made Maheep|| Dinne Nikaar Chhinne Su Deep||12||
translation: He conquered many countries of opponents and destroyed many to the status of royalty; he snatched the countries of many and exiled them.12.

gurmukhi: KMfy su Kyq KUnI KqRIXwx ] mory Amor joDw durwx ] c`ly Ac`l mMfy AmMf ] ik`ny GmMf KMfy pRcMf ]13]
transliteration: Khande Su Khet Khoonikhatreeyaan|| More Amor Jodhaa Duraan Challe Achall Mande Amannd|| Kinne Ghamannd Khande Prachanndd||13||
translation: He killed many dreadful Kshatriyas and suppressed many corrupt and tyrannical warriors; many stable and invincible fighter fled before him and me destroyed many powerful warriors.13.

gurmukhi: ik`ny su jyr KUnI KqRys ] mMfy mhIp mwvws dys ] ieh BwNq dIh dohI iPrwie ] mwnI su mwin mnu rwj rwie ]14]
transliteration: Kinne Su Jer Khoonikhatres|| Mande Maheep Maavaas Des|| Eh Bhaant Deeh Dohiphiraae|| Maanisu Maan(i) Manu Raaj Raae||14||
translation: He subdued many mighty kshatriyas and established many new kings, in the countries of opposing kings, in the way, the king menu was hououred throughout the bravery.14.
